meanings.definition: An infectious disease marked by inflammation and ulceration of the colon, typically causing severe diarrhea with blood and mucus.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with dysentery after observing severe diarrhea and blood in the stool.
meanings.sent2: During the outbreak, many people suffered from dysentery, experiencing intense stomach pain and bloody diarrhea.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned into a disaster when the potato salad caused dysentery among the guests, leading to a chaotic scene.
meanings.sent4: The political corruption spread through the city like dysentery, leaving a trail of destruction and chaos in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The vivid description of dysentery in the novel made the readers cringe at the graphic details of the disease.

meanings.sent1: After eating the spoiled food, he suffered from dysentery, spending hours in the bathroom.
meanings.sent2: The hiker had to cut short his trip due to a sudden onset of dysentery in the wilderness.
meanings.sent3: The comedy movie had the audience laughing uncontrollably when the main character hilariously dealt with a case of dysentery.
meanings.sent4: The team's performance in the championship game was like a case of dysentery, uncontrollable and messy.
meanings.sent5: The image of dysentery in the documentary was so vivid that viewers could almost feel the discomfort of the patients.
